intro: Ophiorrhiza albida, commonly known as the white-flowered marsh bean, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, adapting to waterlogged soils. Its structure includes a short stem with opposite leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. Ophiorrhiza albida plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
